parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To make known, declare, know, discover. From a derivative of ginosko; to make known; subjectively, to know.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.
Life, both of physical (present) and of spiritual (particularly future) existence. From zao; life.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Joy, gladness, rejoicing. From the same as euphraino; joyfulness.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
